snippet: From making a recess appointment to inserting itself into the Iowa caucuses, the Obama campaign is trying to tie his rivals to the unpopular Congress.
abstract: Political Memo; Obama campaign unleashes a carefully scripted and deliberately aggressive strategy that shows a White House in combative re-election mode as the president and his advisers seek to ensure that the Republicans do not get all the political limelight; from making a recess appointment to inserting itself into the Iowa caucuses, the president's campaign is trying to tie his rivals to the unpopular Congress.
lead_paragraph: From making a recess appointment to inserting itself into the Iowa caucuses, the Obama campaign is trying to tie his rivals to the unpopular Congress.

headline.seo: President Obama Unveils Aggressive Re-election Strategy Against G.O.P. Rivals
headline.main: Obama Takes Aim at Congress to Hurt His G.O.P. Rivals
headline.print_headline: Obama Tactic: Jab Congress To Hurt Rivals
